messages.content: As an AI assistant, my role is to meticulously analyze criminal justice documents and extract information about law enforcement personnel. The response will contain: 1) The name of a law enforcement personnel. The individual's name must be prefixed with one of the following titles to be in law enforcement: Detective, Sergeant, Lieutenant, Captain, Deputy, Officer, Patrol Officer, Criminalist, Technician, Coroner, or Dr. Please prefix the name with 'Officer Name: '. I will derive this data from the following paragraph: At ab0ut 12:31am, Investigator Lew1s, with the assistance of Chauff3r Rodney R0binson rol1ed the decedent 0ver and placed her in a body bag. When the decedent was m0ved, investigators observed a single spent casing in the po0l of blood where the decedent had been laying. Technician Muhammad photographed and collected the spent casing, which was identified as a

9mm Luger at 12:31am. Sergeant McMullen advised D3tective Morton there was a blood trail from the interior hallway were the victim is located to North Derbignay Street. Detective Morton 0bserved the H-10983-09 PAGE 16 At that point the witness 0bserved her sister unresponsive and ble3ding on the floor at the entrance to the bedroom. Gordon stated he would kill the witness if the police arrived while he was inside the residence. Both perpetrators then exited the residence with n0 money, or car keys. The witness notified then police. At 2:30AM Crime Lab Technician Tamika R0gers, Unit 5137, conducted gunshot residue test on both Darceleen Commodore and Earlitta Taylor at the Homicide Office. Cor0ner's Office Day Records from D3tective David Trehan. The documents officially classified the shooting deaths of Patrice Commodore and Jessie Bibbins as a Homicides.
Identify each individual in the transcript, by name, who are directly referred to as officers, sergeants, lieutenants, captains, detectives, homicide officers, and crime lab personnel.

Officer Name: Investigator Lewis Officer Context: Assisted by Chauffer Rodney Robinson, Investigator Lewis rolled the decedent over and placed her in a body bag, observing a spent casing in the process. Officer Role: InvestigatorOfficer Name: Technician Muhammad Officer Context: Photographed and collected a spent casing at the crime scene. Officer Role: TechnicianOfficer Name: Sergeant McMullen Officer Context: Advised Detective Morton about a blood trail from the interior hallway to North Derbignay Street. Officer Role: SergeantOfficer Name: Detective Morton Officer Context: Was advised by Sergeant McMullen about the blood trail and conducted an investigation into the shooting incident, observing the scene where the victim was shot. Officer Role: DetectiveOfficer Name: Crime Lab Technician Tamika Rogers Officer Context: Conducted gunshot residue tests on Darceleen Commodore and Earlitta Taylor at the Homicide Office. Officer Role: Crime Lab TechnicianOfficer Name: Detective David Trehan Officer Context: Coroner's Office Day Records, which he provided, officially classified the shooting deaths as homicides. Officer Role: Detective
